void.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a feeling of great sadness that you have when someone you love dies or when something is taken from you
void.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Running the business helped to fill the void after his wife died.
void.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a situation in which something important or interesting is needed or wanted, but does not exist
void.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The amusement park will fill a void in this town, which has little entertainment for children.
void.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: an empty area of space where nothing exists
void.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: She looked over the cliff into the void.
void.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a contract or official agreement that is void is not legal and has no effect
void.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to make a contract or agreement void so that it has no legal effect
void.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: a contract or agreement that is void has no legal effect because it is against the law
void.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: Under state law, a contract to pay money knowingly lent for gambling is void.
